summary: This document is a letter from Lockheed Martin to the Assistant United States Attorney, providing the company's response to a subpoena in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the production of historical aircraft sales and service agreements related to helicopters sold to entities connected to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including Air Ghislaine, Inc., Shmitka Air, Inc., Freedom Air International, Inc., and Hyperion Air LLC.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The criminal case referenced in the document is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The produced documents relate to aircraft sales agreements with entities like Air Ghislaine, Inc., which is directly named after her.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: The letter is addressed to 'Andrew,' the Assistant United States Attorney handling the case, regarding the subpoena response and the adjournment of Lockheed Martin's court appearance.

persons.name: Douglas Jacobs
persons.role: Representative of Five Star Holding Company LLC
persons.context: Named as the contact for Five Star Holding Company LLC, which was the assignee of warranties and training from Air Ghislaine, Inc. in October 2008.

connections.description: The corporate entity 'Air Ghislaine, Inc.' is directly named after Ghislaine Maxwell and was the awardee of helicopter sales contracts from Lockheed Martin/Sikorsky.
The document states 'Hyperion Air LLC is tied to Epstein/Maxwell,' indicating a financial and operational connection through aircraft ownership and agreements.
In October 2008, Air Ghislaine, Inc. assigned all remaining rights and interests in warranties and training to Five Star Holding Company LLC.

A helicopter sales contract was awarded sequentially to Air Ghislaine, Inc., then Shmitka Air, Inc., and finally to Freedom Air International, Inc., indicating a chain of assignment or ownership transfer.
A Powertrain Assurance Program agreement was transferred from Hyperion Air LLC to Integrity Solutions, LLC in June 2021.

events.title: Helicopter Contract Award to Air Ghislaine
events.description: Contract S76TD6167, a New Helicopter Sales Agreement, was awarded to Air Ghislaine, Inc.

events.title: Aircraft Delivery to Air Ghislaine
events.description: Helicopter with serial number 760667 (Tail N908GM) was delivered under the contract awarded to Air Ghislaine, Inc.

events.title: Assignment of Warranties to Five Star Holding
events.description: Air Ghislaine, Inc. executed an assignment of all remaining rights and interest in warranties and training to Five Star Holding Company LLC.

events.title: Second Aircraft Delivery
events.description: Helicopter with serial number 760750 (Tail N722JE) was delivered. The contract had been awarded to Air Ghislaine, Inc., then Shmitka Air, Inc., and finally Freedom Air International, Inc.

events.title: Aircraft Delivery to Hyperion Air
events.description: Hyperion Air LLC accepted delivery of an aircraft from ASI Wings LLC.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance
events.description: Lockheed Martin's appearance in the Ghislaine Maxwell case was scheduled for this date but was expected to be adjourned upon the prosecution's receipt of the subpoenaed documents.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Lockheed Martin produced documents in response to a subpoena in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, revealing detailed financial transactions related to helicopter sales.

The documents show a network of corporate entities (Air Ghislaine, Inc., Shmitka Air, Inc., Freedom Air International, Inc., Hyperion Air LLC) used to purchase and manage helicopters, with clear ties to Ghislaine Maxwell.
A specific note in the document explicitly states 'Hyperion Air LLC is tied to Epstein/Maxwell,' directly linking the aircraft ownership structure to the defendants.
The response details the transfer of assets and agreements between these entities over more than a decade, from 2006 to 2021.
The production was delayed due to the age of the files, some of which predated Lockheed Martin's acquisition of Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation.
